Game.Name: Necros no Yousai (Japan)
Game.plot: Overhead fantasy RPG featuring dynamically animated turn-based battle scenes.http://www.pcengine.co.uk/HTML_Games/Necross_no_Yosai.htmCheat: All The DialogueAt the password screen, enter the following Japanese characters. Format is Row #, Column #. - 1,6 - 1,1 - 3,2 - 5,1 - 5,7 - - 1,2 - 5,1 - 1,2 - 4,5 - 1,4 - 5,8 - 6,3 - - 1,6 - 1,1 - 3,7 - 1,1 - 1,6 - - 3,10 - 3,1 - 1,8 - 5,6 - 1,2 - - 4,10 - 4,12 - 1,1 - 6,3 - 6,6 - 1,1 - 3,1 - - 1,1 - 2,1 - 1,1 - 6,1 - 6,1 - - 6,1 - 6,1 - 6,1 - 6,1 - 6,1 - - 6,1 - 6,1 - 6,1 - 6,1 - 6,1 - 6,1 - 6,1 - - 6,1 - 6,1 - 6,1 - 6,1 -. Once entered, leave the town towards the Tower on the right side of the map. Once there, enter the bar and talk to the bartender. You'll now see every single line of text in the game.Cheat: All The DialogueAt the password screen, enter the following Japanese characters. Format is Row #, Column #.
Game.Notes: Necros no Yousai, or Neclos no Yousai, ("Fortress of Neclos/Necros") is a traditional Japanese RPG that was released exclusively on the PC Engine. It is based on the toyline of the same name, which was one of many brands of "shokugan" or "food toys" - small figurines packaged with candy that were intended for children. The toyline featured the evil sorcerer Neclos/Necros, the eight heroic champions sent to defeat him and Neclos/Necros's various henchmonsters. The game controls like a standard RPG and alternates between a top-down view for talking to NPCs and exploring towns and dungeons and a first-person view for its turn-based combat. The various characters launch into little animated vignettes whenever they attack, and each of the heroes has strengths and weaknesses specific to their class which the player can build strategies around.
